title: Elton Walks

images.title: Richard Humphrey / Elton Hall and gardens
images.caption: Elton Hall and gardens. The grand baronial has served as the family seat of the Proby family, also known as the Earls of Carysfort, since 1660. The hall is part of a vast 3,800-acre estate, traversed by the River Nene, featuring architectural elements from the 15th, 17th, 18th, and 19th centuries. It is recognised as a Grade I listed building. Located just 2 miles from Fotheringhay Castle, the site of Mary, Queen of Scots' execution in 1587, Elton Hall holds a significant place in English history.

images.title: Pond and garden at Elton Hall by Richard Humphrey, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Pond and garden at Elton Hall. The Victorian gardens at Elton Hall have been meticulously revitalised in recent times, showcasing a knot garden, a newly established rose and herbaceous garden, exquisite hedges, and a Gothic orangery, constructed in celebration of the Millennium. These gardens are supported by the Campaign to Protect Rural England.

images.title: Village Hall, Elton by N Chadwick, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Village Hall, Elton. Elton used to have a railway station but it closed in 1953. It is now a popular walk.

images.title: Fields north of the village street, Elton by Andrew Hill, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons

description: This Cambridgeshire village is located a few miles west of Peterborough . Other local settlements include Fotheringhay , Warmington and Nassington . The village notably includes Elton Hall , a part Gothic house, surrounded by beautiful parkland and gardens. The hall is open to the public during the summer months and a lovely place for a stroll. The River Nene, ranking as the UK's tenth longest river, also gracefully flows by Elton, offering idyllic banks ideal for walking, picnicking, or fishing. Please scroll down for the full list of walks near and around Elton. The detailed maps below also show a range of footpaths, bridleways and cycle paths in the area.
